model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpertAIPlayer, HumanPlayer, IntermediateAIPlayer, SimpleAIPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.util.Observable
    Abstract class to represent players in the game of Risk. Implemented by SimpleAIPlayer, IntermediateAIPlayer, ExpertAIPlayer, and HumanPlayer.
    Author:
    Steven Broussard, Elizabeth Harris, Jeremy Jalnos, Becca Simon

    • Method Detail

      • placeArmy

        public abstract void placeArmy()
        During the start of the game, choose a territory in which to claim, then place remaining armies. During turns, place armies until all armies for that turn are placed. Each time you place only one army.

      • reinforceArmies

        public abstract void reinforceArmies()
        For iteration 2, at the end of turn, player is allowed to reinforce by pulling armies from one country and placing them in another country
        Parameters:
        takeArmy - the territory selected to take armies from
        reinforceThis - the territory selected to move the armies too.

      • attackFrom

        public abstract Territory attackFrom()
        determines the territory to attack from during a turn, territory must have at least 2 armies
        Returns:
        the territory to attack from

      • attackTo

        public abstract Territory attackTo(Territory attackFrom)
        Determines the territory that is being attacked by finding an adjacent territory that is owned by another player.
        Parameters:
        attackFrom - the territory that is attacking
        Returns:
        the territory that is being attacked

      • addArmies

        public void addArmies()
        At the beginning of the turn determines the number of armies that the player receives to reinforce territories. Adds this number to the numArmies variable. By the rulebook, a player is entitled to a minimum of three armies even if he owns fewer than nine territories. If the player owns an entire continent, then they get a bonus depending on which continent it is. Continent bonuses: Asia (7 armies), North America (5 armies), Europe (5 armies), Africa (3 armies), Australia (2 armies) and South America (2 armies). If the player turns in a set of cards, they get a bonus number of armies, and if the player owns the territory on the face of one of the cards being turned in, they get an additional two armies for that territory.

      • addTerritory

        public void addTerritory(Territory toAdd)
        Adds a territory to the list of territories owned.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - the territory to be added

      • canAttack

        public boolean canAttack()
        Determines if the player is able to attack. In order to attack, the player must have a territory with at least two armies and has an adjacent territory that is owned by another player. The player also has the option of setting the variable doneAttacking to true to indicate they are done attacking and want to end their turn
        Returns:
        true if the player is able to attack, false if the player is unable to attack or is done with their turn.

      • canTurnInCards

        public boolean canTurnInCards()
        Determines if the player can turn in a set of three cards, and if possible, turns in a set of cards. A set of cards consists of three of a kind (cannon, horseman, or foot soldier), one of each kind, or a wild card plus any two.
        Returns:
        true if the player can turn in a set of cards, false if they cannot.

      • issueCard

        public void issueCard(Card c)
        Represents a player drawing a card from the deck. Takes the card passed by the deck, adds it to the player's hand, and removes it from the deck.
        Parameters:
        c -
